html:
** Tesla TSLA.O shares down 7.3% at $1,078.41 on Tues, adding to 4.8% drop in prior session, and on track for biggest 2-day drop since Sept 2020

** EV maker's stock losing traction as investors prepare for CEO Musk's proposed sale of about a tenth of his holdings following his Twitter poll over the weekend (Full Story)

** Given TSLA's avg trading volume, Musk's stake sale "will not overwhelm the market if done over time," S3 Partners' Ihor Dusaniwsky, managing director of predictive analytics, said in an email to Reuters (Full Story)

** Meanwhile, Rivian Automotive Inc RIVN.O is poised to price about $10 bln IPO later Tues ahead of one of this year's most hotly anticipated debuts slated for Weds (Full Story)

** Backed by both Amazon.com Inc AMZN.O and Ford Motor Co F.N, Rivian last Fri boosted its price range, and plans to sell 135 mln shares in range of $72-$74, as investors bet on co to be the next big player in sector dominated by TSLA


(Lance Tupper is a Reuters market analyst. The views expressed are his own)

(( lance.tupper@thomsonreuters.com
lance.tupper@tr.com 1-332-219-1430) )
